summary: When you gotta listen to someone rage about Sansa and you get to say, “What a good day to remember that Sansa is Queen in the...
body:
When you gotta listen to someone rage about Sansa and you get to say, “What a good day to remember that Sansa is Queen in the North.”

But everyday is a good day to remember that Queen Sansa is Queen.

summary: GODDD when they started shouting “queen in the north” chills. literal chills.
question: GODDD when they started shouting “queen in the north” chills. literal chills.
answer: That scene was so powerful. Sansa has been dismissed and being used as a political piece to a wider game in the earlier parts of the show, and even later in the show where she would impose herself and her opinions more, she would get overlooked (mostly by Jon who constantly dismissed her and her opinions, but also the Northern Lords who constantly disregarded her contribution in favor of Jon’s more male-coded) so to see her triumph in every way possible, and then get the praise and position she deserves is so satisfying. The fact that the ‘’Queen in the North’’ chant was the last piece of dialogue in the show makes this even more glorious. There was a time where people wouldn’t even consider Sansa ruling the North because they didn’t see her as being an important enough character, yet here she is at the end of the series, having survived despite having been surrounded by some of the worst serial killers and best players in the game of thrones (she outlived them all!!!) for years, having been the heart to the northern rebellion against the Boltons, having become one of the most efficient and capable ruler who’s still alive, who is now the ‘’Queen In The North’’.

reblog.comment: That scene was so powerful. Sansa has been dismissed and being used as a political piece to a wider game in the earlier parts of the show, and even later in the show where she would impose herself and her opinions more, she would get overlooked (mostly by Jon who constantly dismissed her and her opinions, but also the Northern Lords who constantly disregarded her contribution in favor of Jon’s more male-coded) so to see her triumph in every way possible, and then get the praise and position she deserves is so satisfying. The fact that the ‘’Queen in the North’’ chant was the last piece of dialogue in the show makes this even more glorious. There was a time where people wouldn’t even consider Sansa ruling the North because they didn’t see her as being an important enough character, yet here she is at the end of the series, having survived despite having been surrounded by some of the worst serial killers and best players in the game of thrones (she outlived them all!!!) for years, having been the heart to the northern rebellion against the Boltons, having become one of the most efficient and capable ruler who’s still alive, who is now the ‘’Queen In The North’’.

Sansa has been dismissed and being used as a political piece to a wider game in the earlier parts of the show, and even later in the show where she would impose herself and her opinions more, she would get overlooked (mostly by Jon who constantly dismissed her and her opinions, but also the Northern Lords who constantly disregarded her contribution in favor of Jon’s more male-coded) so to see her triumph in every way possible, and then get the praise and position she deserves is so satisfying. The fact that the ‘’Queen in the North’’ chant was the last piece of dialogue in the show makes this even more glorious. There was a time where people wouldn’t even consider Sansa ruling the North because they didn’t see her as being an important enough character, yet here she is at the end of the series, having survived despite having been surrounded by some of the worst serial killers and best players in the game of thrones (she outlived them all!!!) for years, having been the heart to the northern rebellion against the Boltons, having become one of the most efficient and capable ruler who’s still alive, who is now the ‘’Queen In The North’’.

Sansa has been dismissed and being used as a political piece to a wider game in the earlier parts of the show, and even later in the show where she would impose herself and her opinions more, she would get overlooked (mostly by Jon who constantly dismissed her and her opinions, but also the Northern Lords who constantly disregarded her contribution in favor of Jon’s more male-coded) so to see her triumph in every way possible, and then get the praise and position she deserves is so satisfying. The fact that the ‘’Queen in the North’’ chant was the last piece of dialogue in the show makes this even more glorious. There was a time where people wouldn’t even consider Sansa ruling the North because they didn’t see her as being an important enough character, yet here she is at the end of the series, having survived despite having been surrounded by some of the worst serial killers and best players in the game of thrones (she outlived them all!!!) for years, having been the heart to the northern rebellion against the Boltons, having become one of the most efficient and capable ruler who’s still alive, who is now the ‘’Queen In The North’’.

summary: Headcanon that Arya gives Sansa and Sandor a litter of puppies as a wedding present. The youngest girl puppy becomes the apple...
body:
Headcanon that Arya gives Sansa and Sandor a litter of puppies as a wedding present. The youngest girl puppy becomes the apple of Sandor’s eye.

“Little bird, stop feeding the dogs from the table. We spoil them too much.”

“Even Jonquil?”

“Of course not Jonquil. She’s my little princess girl. She deserves everything.”

Jonquil gets quite chubby.

summary: Hey I have a question about Sanaa’s marriage. Fans say that Sansa and Tyrion are married (and that Tyrion is currently the KiTN)...
question: Hey I have a question about Sanaa’s marriage. Fans say that Sansa and Tyrion are married (and that Tyrion is currently the KiTN) but the last person married was Ramsey? So if Sansa was able to marry Ramsey then that would make her marriage to Tyrion void. Like last time i checked she wasn’t currently married to anyone?
answer: The show doesn’t dwell about the details of things, but it is implied that because Sansa’s marriage with Tyrion was unconsummated, it was easily annulled, and by consequence, she was then able to marry Ramsey. With Ramsey dead, she is no longer married to anyone, which is fortified by the fact that after Ramsey’s death, she hasn’t been called ‘’Lady Lannister’’ or ‘’Lady Bolton’’ by anyone, because she is legally recognized as Sansa Stark. People just pretend that her forced marriage with Tyrion is still in effect either because they like the pairing, or they just want to demean her. Again, the show ignores most of the rules set in the books, so the only thing to pay attention to is what is shown, and what has been shown is Sansa ruling the North alone.

reblog.comment: The show doesn’t dwell about the details of things, but it is implied that because Sansa’s marriage with Tyrion was unconsummated, it was easily annulled, and by consequence, she was then able to marry Ramsey. With Ramsey dead, she is no longer married to anyone, which is fortified by the fact that after Ramsey’s death, she hasn’t been called ‘’Lady Lannister’’ or ‘’Lady Bolton’’ by anyone, because she is legally recognized as Sansa Stark. People just pretend that her forced marriage with Tyrion is still in effect either because they like the pairing, or they just want to demean her. Again, the show ignores most of the rules set in the books, so the only thing to pay attention to is what is shown, and what has been shown is Sansa ruling the North alone.

trail.content_raw: The show doesn’t dwell about the details of things, but it is implied that because Sansa’s marriage with Tyrion was unconsummated, it was easily annulled, and by consequence, she was then able to marry Ramsey. With Ramsey dead, she is no longer married to anyone, which is fortified by the fact that after Ramsey’s death, she hasn’t been called ‘’Lady Lannister’’ or ‘’Lady Bolton’’ by anyone, because she is legally recognized as Sansa Stark. People just pretend that her forced marriage with Tyrion is still in effect either because they like the pairing, or they just want to demean her. Again, the show ignores most of the rules set in the books, so the only thing to pay attention to is what is shown, and what has been shown is Sansa ruling the North alone.
trail.content: The show doesn’t dwell about the details of things, but it is implied that because Sansa’s marriage with Tyrion was unconsummated, it was easily annulled, and by consequence, she was then able to marry Ramsey. With Ramsey dead, she is no longer married to anyone, which is fortified by the fact that after Ramsey’s death, she hasn’t been called ‘’Lady Lannister’’ or ‘’Lady Bolton’’ by anyone, because she is legally recognized as Sansa Stark. People just pretend that her forced marriage with Tyrion is still in effect either because they like the pairing, or they just want to demean her. Again, the show ignores most of the rules set in the books, so the only thing to pay attention to is what is shown, and what has been shown is Sansa ruling the North alone.

blog.title: Not a dancer. A khaleesi. But also a dancer.
blog.description: Mademoiselle Meg Giry from The Phantom of the Opera is the dancer, not me. She's a badass ballerina babe who don't take no guff. I also tend to write and reblog a lot of SanSan meta from Game of Thrones.
